title.rendered: Top 5 Board Games To Play When Bored

content.rendered:
Board games have been a means of entertainment and joy for a long period of time. There was no better way to spend your time than playing board games with your friends and close ones. Not only do they keep you entertained but has a sense of inclusiveness and profundity about them which hardly any other games have. All you needed a simple board mechanics, some coins, and dice to play your games.

Boredom is a common disease that infects each and evet human being out there but fortunately, we have got the right solution to get out of this void. Board games are indeed the best to kill the boring time that often makes our day miserable and unhappening. But what are the best board games one can play especially when now you have got the option of online gaming, there can be total confusion, right?

Well, we have got you covered. These are the games you should play when you are bored.

Carrom:

Carrom is a board game where a total of 2-4 players can play at a time. The game involved two coloured coins and a striker which is used to strike the coins on the board. The aim is to pocket these coins in the four holes made on the corners of the board. The game has popular variations like Total point, Family point, Duboo, Tokyu-ban, and Professional carrom. What is so special about this game is that it keeps you on the edge of your seat and has a lot of twists and turns.

Ludo:

When talking about board games you’ve got to talk about ludo. I mean there’s no other game designed in a simplistic manner yet leaving an ever-lasting effect on us. Moreover, the game does teach you a lot in general about patience, planning, strategies, and making the most of your opportunities. It’s a cat and a mouse game at times with role reversals, once you are hunting and then the next you are the hunted. It is truly a gem of a game that will and always remain a fan favoruite in the board game world.

Snake and Ladders:

Snakes and Ladders is another classic that has etched itself on your memory for a lifetime. The game is simple, reach the finish marker through the 100 boxes without getting bitten by the snakes. Well, anxiety is real when you play this one but surely gives the game a more thrilling dynamic, here you are competing against your friends and at the same time dealing with the threats on hand. It’s just chaos of the best kind which you would more of it every time you play.

Business:

If you ever want to feel accomplished then Business is the game made for you. This again is a simple yet interactive board game where you have a limited budget, buy assets, and charge other players when they land upon it. This was indeed a tricky one as you are spoiled for choices across the board and this is what makes the game rather more interesting to play. There are different versions of the game where it can be city-specific or area specific which adds more flavour to the overall fun.

Chess:

Not a whole bunch of the crowd enjoys this particular game, and the reasons are justified as well. True this is not the board game that everyone prefers to play but there are players who are fascinated and hooked to this one. Chess requires you to function at the highest level of the brain, here you have to predict, plot, and execute to win. The pawns, King, Queen, Knight, Bishop, and Rooks are the pieces on the board, using their special abilities and pathways the players need to outplay and kill the opposition pieces. This is the best of the brain games on this list and therefore worthy of mention.
